text: Input may refer to: ==Computing== *Input (computer science), the act of entering data into a computer or data processing system *Information, any data entered into a computer or data processing system *Invisible potion *Input method *Input device ==Other== * Input (talk show) * Input (typeface) * International Public Television Screening Conference (INPUT), an international public television organization ==See also== * Input/output, in computing * Input port (disambiguation) * Independent variable in a mathematical function * In economics, a factor of production, a resource employed to produce goods and services * Advice (opinion), an opinion or recommendation offered as a guide to action or conduct, or a contribution to a discussion.
title: Input
